title: TFDeepExplainer not working with 1-layer NN + Softmax
body:
Using TF 2.1.0  + SHAP ~HEAD

Minimum failing example:

```python

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import tensorflow as tf
from shap import DeepExplainer

x = pd.DataFrame(
    {
        "B": np.random.random(size=(100,)),
    }
)
y = x.B
y = y.map(lambda zz: chr(int(zz * 2 + 65))).str.get_dummies()

d = tf.keras.models.Sequential()
d.add(tf.keras.layers.Dense(y.shape[1], input_shape=(x.shape[1],), activation="softmax"))
d.summary()
d.compile(loss="categorical_crossentropy", optimizer="Adam")
d.fit(x.values, y.values, epochs=2)

e = DeepExplainer(d, x.values)
print(e.shap_values(x.values))
```

    /usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/deep_tf.py:236 grad_graph  *
        x_grad = tape.gradient(out, shap_rAnD)
    /usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow_core/python/eager/backprop.py:1029 gradient
        unconnected_gradients=unconnected_gradients)
    /usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow_core/python/eager/imperative_grad.py:77 imperative_grad
        compat.as_str(unconnected_gradients.value))
    /usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow_core/python/eager/backprop.py:141 _gradient_function
        return grad_fn(mock_op, *out_grads)
    /usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/deep_tf.py:352 custom_grad
        return op_handlers[op.type](self, op, *grads)
    /usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/deep_tf.py:449 softmax
        in0 = op.inputs[0]

    TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable


It indeed seems the op's input is None.
However, I couldn't find out yet at which point it is set to None.
